body: Thank you!  I ended up just downgrading clang per your suggestion, and I am all set.  I appreciate your help.
This is a harmless error unless you want to use mxnet.recordio
The nosetests run on my computer, so I don't really know how to fix it. Do you have any insight?
There's no way to weight samples?

Not generic way I think. However, depending on your loss, sometimes it's possible to archive weighting by scaling your label. You need to do the math and see if it's possible. Basically try to push the weight inside and let `new_y = w*y`.
If you need a new operator, you should be able to do it easily with regression output by creating two ops like this `return new RegressionOutputOp<cpu, mshadow_op::sigmoid, mshadow::op::minus>(param);`

I had a similar problem. I fixed it by following two steps: 
make clean_all
source ~/.bashrc
Normally we can scale the gradient, but that does not cope well with SGD, building a DataIter that do the sample generation is a better way.
Thanks @piiswrong and @tqchen. What do you mean by sample generation; just adding a sample the same number of times as the weight?

Yes, sample instance proportional to weight usually works better for sgd
type algorithms

On Fri, Jan 8, 2016 at 4:05 PM Jacob Schreiber notifications@github.com
wrote:

> Thanks @piiswrong https://github.com/piiswrong and @tqchen
> https://github.com/tqchen. What do you mean by sample generation; just
> adding a sample the same number of times as the weight?
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/issues/1211#issuecomment-170161539.
Looks like the lint check is still failing, but the python tests are passing now.
Solved.  After 2 epochs, the learning rate becomes 0.0081 and it needs to be added manually to the command line when you resume the training
@alirezabagheri Great! I would appreciate if you can contribute and share you code for Early Stropping and Saving Model.
can you execute the 'locate libvrtc.so'
caffe and mxnet all in the cpu model?
@qiaohaijun yes, CPU on same machine

@piiswrong here is compare between MxNet and caffe. Both has totally same model and params, were computed on CPU on same machine. But, the predict time of MxNet is about 4 times slow than caffe. Btw, caffe uses one thread on CPU, and they both are built with atlas.
get the same error after re-installation

Hi, guys,
Is there anything blocking from merging it in?

The json file also shows 1008 in the fully connect layer. Why is it 1008 instead of 1000?

```
  "op": "FullyConnected", 
  "param": {
    "no_bias": "False", 
    "num_hidden": "1008"
```
Sorry. Travis has been really slow recently. Merged.

Oops. I probably merged too soon. There is a potential problem: when req[i] = NullOp, the corresponding in_grad blob may not be initialized, so calling get_with_shape on it is not safe. Plus it would be good if you can also handle AddTo. 
two suggestions:
There is no need for a mask, just pass in req
Save the dimensions in forward pass. because in backward pass, for NullOp, neither in_data nor in_grad is available.

Could you do the fix and open another PR?
try numpy.mmap.
How did you prepare your cifar10/train.rec? Looks like it's corrupt.
numpy memory maps will work, but only if you've saved them as memory maps before hand.

fixed by https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/pull/1227
Please pull the change, remake, remove cifar10/mean.bin, and try again.
Thanks for reporting this bug.
please refer to https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/issues/1224
we have callback.Speedometer. If you want wall clock time, time.time() should be good enough.
set USE_NVRTC=0 in config.mk
You can reproduce lint check locally via `make lint`
libpangoft2 is a gnome library. I'm guessing your opencv is not correctly installed/linked. Try compiling with USE_OPENCV=0 and see if the error persists.

let use consider move future unary activation function to https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/blob/master/src/ndarray/unary_function-inl.h instead, they will be exposed to both ndarray and operators, and needs shorter code
What exactly do you want early stopping to do? You can checkpoint the model and exit the program in epoch_end callbacks.
Thanks for the contribution, I have added you to https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/blob/master/CONTRIBUTORS.md Please feel free to update contents about your self, and help making mxnet better

Thanks for the contribution, I have added you to https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/blob/master/CONTRIBUTORS.md  

Thanks for making mxnet better and more accessible for more users
what is your compiler version? does it support c++11?

Thanks for this contribution! have added you to https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/blob/master/CONTRIBUTORS.md

Please feel free to push more changes, and help making mxnet and mxnetR more accessible for the community

https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/releases
@jmschrei Yes, depending on your data format, you may want CVSIter.

On OS X Yosemite, RStudio would fail loading dynamic libraires so I ended up loading them explicitly before the requires. Now able to reproduce expected results. Shame that system-wide env vars in OS X are such a pain compared to Linux.

```
dyn.load('/usr/local/cuda/lib/libcudart.7.5.dylib')
dyn.load('/usr/local/cuda/lib/libcublas.dylib')
dyn.load('/usr/local/cuda/lib/libcurand.dylib')
dyn.load('/usr/local/cudnn-3.0/lib/libcudnn.dylib')

require(mxnet)
require(data.table)
```
@lelayf  You can also try to startup Rstudio from termimal by `/Applications/RStudio.app/Contents/MacOS/RStudio`

@piiswrong, note that I do not call `get_with_shape` if `req[i]` is `kNullOp`, I moved it down after check. I only get one dimension of the shape from `in_grad`. The shape appears to be always initialized (the test I wrote intentionally runs the case with nullop before the case without so that properly initialized memory doesn't appear there by chance, and it seems to pass). 

I will apply your suggestions and send a PR. I might not be able to do it this/next week, but in the current state code seems to be not worse than before, so it is unlikely to cause any problems in the meantime.

@piiswrong I've fixed the code.

there is a typo in train_cifar10.py, I think num-examples are 50000, If you want to reproduce my work, you might use num-examples 50000 as well, though generally speaking, it does not matter whether num-exmaples is 50000 or 60000.
one more thing, I use batch-size of 128, and train the models by using one GPU. :)

I am really sorry I can't reproduce your errors.

The code runs well on my machine and we test all examples on Travis CI.

My suggestion is following:

(1) checkout the latest version of code;
(2) `make clean_all`
(3) `make`
(4) `make rpkg; R CMD INSTALL mxnet_0.5.tar.gz`

If you still have errors, please give me more info about your machine, including whether you are using GPU, 64 or 32 bit machine, and your R `sessionInfo()`.

The general structure LGTM, some major comments:
- Let us separate build rule for plugin, this helps later extensions.
  - Possibly with a separate Makefile
- Let us implement all the features without torch.py. I guess it is doable This allows things to be more easily incorporated into other front-end. e.g Julia and R more easily.

Plugin option:
- Compile libmxnet_torch.so separately(which links to libluajit.so) and when loaded, it presents all the features.
also cc @mavenlin on reviewing and @pluskid @thirdwing on language interfacing issues

I was unable to build in OS X with gpu, but could for cpu. I did not set:

```
ADD_LDFLAGS = -I/usr/local/opt/openblas/lib -I/Developer/NVIDIA/CUDA-7.5/lib
ADD_CFLAGS = -I/usr/local/opt/openblas/include -I/Developer/NVIDIA/CUDA-7.5/include
```

but did set:

```
USE_CUDA = 1
USE_CUDA_PATH=/usr/local/cuda
```

After that I received a warning about `/usr/local/cuda/lib64` missing. This directory does not exist in the OS X installation of the cuda toolkit. For a workaround I created a soft link `/usr/local/cuda/lib64 -> /usr/local/cuda/lib` and then was able to build with gpu enabled.
